name: HTML
title: HTML is the standard markup language for creating Web pages.
details: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language for creating Web pages. HTML describes the structure of a Web page, HTML consists of a series of elements and tell the browser how to display the content

name: CSS
title: CSS is the language we use to style a Web page.
details: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets . CSS describes how HTML elements are to be displayed on screen, paper, or in other media. CSS saves a lot of work. It can control the layout of multiple web pages all at once. External stylesheets are stored in CSS files

name: JavaScript
title: This page contains some examples of what JavaScript can do.
details: This page contains some examples of what JavaScript can do. JavaScript and Java are completely different languages, both in concept and design.

name: React JS
title: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
details: React makes it painless to create interactive UIs. React (also known as React.js or ReactJS) is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components.

name: Node JS
title: Node.js is an open source server environment;
details: Node.js is an open source server environment. Node.js is free. Node.js runs on various platforms (Windows, Linux, Unix, Mac OS X, etc.)

name: BootStrap
title: Bootstrap is the most popular CSS Framework for developing responsive
details: Bootstrap is a powerful CSS Framework for developing responsive, feature-packed frontend toolkit. Build anything—from prototype to production—in minutes.

name: Github
title: The complete developer platform to build, scale, and deliver secure software.
details: Record or rewind any change to your code to keep you and your team in sync. Host it all for free with unlimited public and private repositories.

name: TailWind CSS
title: A utility-first CSS framework packed
details: A utility-first CSS framework packed with classes like flex, pt-4, text-center and rotate-90 that can be composed to build any design, directly in your markup. Node.js uses JavaScript on the server.
